# abortModal()

**Instance Method**

Aborts the event loop started by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/runModal(for:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/runModalSession(_:)].

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func abortModal()
```

## Discussion

When stopped with this method, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/runModal(for:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/runModalSession(_:)] return `NSModalResponseAbort`.

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/abortModal()] must be used instead of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/stopModal()] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/stopModal(withCode:)] when you need to stop a modal event loop from anywhere other than a callout from that event loop. In other words, if you want to stop the loop in response to a user’s actions within the modal window, use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/stopModal()]; otherwise, use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/abortModal()]. For example, use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/abortModal()] when running in a different thread from AppKit’s main thread or when responding to an `NSTimer` that you have added to the `NSModalPanelRunLoopMode` mode of the default `NSRunLoop`.

## Related Documentation

- **endModalSession(_:)**: Finishes a modal session.

## Running a Modal Window

- **runModal(for:)**: Starts a modal event loop for the specified window.
- **stopModal()**: Stops a modal event loop.
- **stopModal(withCode:)**: Stops a modal event loop, allowing you to return a custom result code.
- **beginModalSession(for:)**: Sets up a modal session with the given window and returns a pointer to the `NSModalSession` structure representing the session.
- **runModalSession(_:)**: Runs a given modal session, as defined in a previous invocation of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/beginModalSession(for:)].
- **modalWindow**: The modal window displayed by the app.
- **NSApplication.ModalResponse**: A set of button return values for modal dialogs.
- **NSApplication.ModalSession**: Variables of type `NSModalSession` point to information used by the system between `NSApplication`’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/beginModalSession(for:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/endModalSession(_:)] messages.
